module.p: -(e)ach is a suffix mainly used to create derived adjectives from nouns. These derived adjectives may also be converted into masculine common nouns describing the class of people (men) with the relevant quality.
cf. H. Cameron Gillies (1902) The Elements of Gaelic Grammar p.151.

section.p:
For example –
aincheard buffoon ⇒ aincheardach buffoon-like
ain-dlighe injustice ⇒ ain-dligheach unlawful, illegitimate
aindeoin reluctance ⇒ aindeònach reluctant, unwilling
aineol stranger, strangeness ⇒ aineolach ignorant
ana-miann lust ⇒ ana-miannach lustful, libidinous
beus moral, virtue ⇒ beusach decent, virtuous
coitheanal
congregation ⇒ coitheanalach adj. congregational(ist)
crìoch fem. (pl. crìochan) end, boundary ⇒ crìoch(n)ach adj. finite
dìcheall
diligence, effort, application ⇒ dìcheallach adj. diligent, hardworking, conscientious
dual
birthright ⇒ dual(t)ach adj. inherent, innate
dual
birthright, inheritance ⇒ dualach adj. inherent, innate ⇒ dualchas
tradition, heritage ⇒ dualchasach adj. traditional
eaglais
church ⇒ eaglaiseach
ecclesiastical
easbaig
bishop ⇒ easbaigeach
episcopal
fìrinn truth ⇒ fìrinneach truthful (cf. fìor true)
Gàidheal
Gael, Highlander ⇒ Gàidhealach adj. pertaining to the Gaels or the Highlands
gnàth
custom, practice, habit, usage, convention ⇒ gnàthach adj. customary, normal, usual, habitual, routine
mì-bheus immorality ⇒ mì-bheusach immoral, indecorous
mì-chiata dislike ⇒ mì-chiatach unseemly, awful
mì-chinnt uncertainty ⇒ mì-chinnteach uncertain
mì-chliù infamy, disrepute ⇒ mì-chliùiteach disreputable
mì-chothrom unfairness ⇒ mì-chothromach unfair, uneven
mì-chreideas distrust ⇒ mì-chreideasach distrustful
mì-chùram carelessness ⇒ mì-chùramach careless
mì-dhealbh deformity ⇒ mì-dhealbhach grotesque, shapeless
mì-earbsa misgiving ⇒ mì-earbsach mistrustful
mì-fhoighidinn impatience ⇒ mì-fhoighidneach impatient
mì-fhortan misfortune ⇒ mì-fhortanach unfortunate
mì-onair dishonesty ⇒ mì-onarach dishonest
mì-riaghailt chaos, disorder ⇒ mì-riaghailteach disorderly
mì-rùn enmity, malice ⇒ mì-rùnach malicious
mì-shealbh misadventure, misfortune ⇒ mì-shealbhach unfortunate, unlucky
sunnd good humour ⇒ sunndach cheerful

module.p:
For example –
Dòmhnall
Donald ⇒ Dòmhnallach adj. pertaining to Donald ⇒ Dòmhnallach
a MacDonald
Camshron
Cameron ⇒ Camshronach adj. pertaining to Cameron ⇒ Camshronach
a Cameron

For example –
deich ten, 10 ⇒ deicheach adj. decimal

giuthas
pine ⇒ giùthsach fem. pine forest
iubhar
yew ⇒ iùbhrach fem. yew grove
